isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - OIL PAN INSTALLATION - VISCOUS VIBRATION DAMPER

step1.para: Install the viscous vibration damper and pulley as follows:

step2.para: Heat the crankshaft pulley to approximately 204° C (400° F). Use a 199° C (388° F) thermomelt crayon (see tool list for tool No.) to determine temperature.

note.para: The marked surface will melt and become a glossy liquid.

step2.para: Lightly coat key and keyway areas with No. 2 (BLACK) Permatex and install key.

Using asbestos gloves, align the keyway with the key in the crankshaft and push the pulley onto the shaft. Use bolts which are longer than the damper retainer bolts to draw the pulley onto the crankshaft. Remove the long bolts and install the damper retainer using the correct bolts and tighten to the specified special torque.
Install viscous damper to crankshaft pulley with the hardened washers and capscrew.
